SchwurblerControlllers  1.0.0
The german foto podcast legend Happy Shooting had a discussion about Midi controller for Lightroom. One comment on the website and voila a new project is born. This project will (hopefully) contain everything from zero to hero to get create your own customized Midi Controller for Lightroom. It is completly community driven, so everyone is allowed to contribute. And it's not intended to earn money with it. Just from the community for the community. In general you might even need no case, just the pcb with the solded parts. so you will get an extra small extra lightwight device. If that's the thing for you we might even go the capacitive way and reduce the soldered components and weight to a minimum.
  • include

67 class ButtonController {
68  public:
69  /*
70  * Buttoncontroller constructor
71  * @param amount amount of Buttons the controller should be able to handle
72  * @param pinList List of pin numbers matches Button by Button e.g. {1, 2, 3}
73  * @param midiValueList List of Midivalues matches Button by Button e.g. {21,
74  * 22, 23} Hint on Buttonmapping:
75  * First Entry of pinList will be matched to first entry of
76  * midiValueList etc.
77  *
78  * Based on pinlist a debounced Array will be created in button
79  */
80 
81  ButtonController() {
82  for (int i = 0; i <= kAmount; i++) {
83  this->buttons[i] = Bounce(this->pins[i], this->kBounceTime);
84  }
85  }
86 
87  ~ButtonController() {
88  #ifndef Schwurbler_DEF_ButtonController_Pins
89  delete[] this->pins;
90  #endif // Schwurbler_DEF_ButtonController_Pins
91  #ifndef Schwurbler_DEF_ButtonController_Keys
92  delete[] this->midiKeys;
93  #endif // Schwurbler_DEF_ButtonController_Keys
94  }
95 
96  private:
97  const uint8_t kAmount = Schwurbler_DEF_ButtonController_Amount;
98  const int pins[Schwurbler_DEF_ButtonController_Amount] = Schwurbler_DEF_ButtonController_Pins;

100  Bounce buttons[Schwurbler_DEF_ButtonController_Amount];
